Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
chummy \chummy\ adj. 1. having the relationship of friends or pals. [colloquial]
Syn: matey, pally, palsy-walsy. [WordNet 1.5]
2. associated on close terms. [informal]
Syn: thick(predicate). [WordNet 1.5]

chummy adj 1: (used colloquially) having the relationship of friends or pals [syn: {matey}, {pally}, {palsy-walsy}] 2: (used informally) associated on close terms; "a close friend"; "the bartender was chummy with the regular customers"; "the two were thick as thieves for months" [syn: {buddy-buddy}, {thick(p)}] [also: {chummiest}, {chummier}]
